1.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Expressly, explicitly, in so many words. Adverb from a derivative of rheo; out-spokenly, i.e. Distinctly.

1.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Later, latter, last. Comparative from hupo; later.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

1.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
1.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

1.str2: From apo and histemi; to remove, i.e. instigate to revolt; usually to desist, desert, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

1.str2: From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.
Roving, i.e. an impostor or misleader.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.

2.str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From hupokrinomai; acting under a feigned part, i.e. deceit.
False-speaking, speaking lies. From pseudes and lego; mendacious, i.e. Promulgating erroneous Christian doctrine.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.

2.word: are seared with a hot iron.
2.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
2.str2: To cauterize, burn with a hot iron; hence met: I sear. From a derivative of kaio; to brand, i.e. to render unsensitive.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
3.str2: To prevent, debar, hinder; with infin: from doing so and so. From the base of kolazo; to estop, i.e. Prevent.
To marry, used of either sex. From gamos; to wed.
To have in full, be far, it is enough. From apo and echo; to have out, i.e. Receive in full; to keep away, i.e. Be distant.
Food of any kind. From the base of bibrosko; food, especially articles allowed or forbidden by the Jewish law.

3.str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

3.str2: To create, form, shape, make, always of God. Probably akin to ktaomai; to fabricate, i.e. Found.

Participation, sharing in, receiving. From metalambano; participation.

A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.

Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
